spans.text: CHAPTER 3 RURAL SETTLEMENT AND URBAN SETTLEMENT
Land use zones and mapwork interpretation
It is important that you understand how to identify land use zones on a topographic map
or orthophoto, as this is a frequently asked question in the Mapwork section of the exam
â¢ In the centre of the town
â¢ Near CBD or industrial area or sewage disposal works or railway line
â¢ Very small blocks (grey blocks on a map show built-up areas)
â¢ On outskirts of town (but not near factories or sewage works)
â¢ Near to golf courses or the sea
â¢ Next to main transport routes (highway or railroad)
â¢ Indicated by large black blocks on the map
In Paper 1 and Paper 2 you may be asked to identify the
land use zones seen in diagrams, cartoons, photographs and
on a topographic map or on an orthophoto. You may also be asked to describe the
characteristics of the land use zone. Learn the above information to help you answer

CHAPTER 3 RURAL SETTLEMENT AND URBAN SETTLEMENT  63
Chapter
3
Land use zones and mapwork interpretation
It is important that you understand how to identify land use zones on a topographic map 
or orthophoto, as this is a frequently asked question in the Mapwork section of the exam 
(Paper 2).
Central Business District
â¢ In the centre of the town
â¢ Has a gridiron pattern
â¢ Transport routes meet here
Working class residential zone
â¢ Near CBD or industrial area or sewage disposal works or railway line
â¢ Very small blocks (grey blocks on a map show built-up areas)
Upper class residential areas
â¢ On outskirts of town (but not near factories or sewage works)
â¢ Near to golf courses or the sea
â¢ Large grey blocks
Heavy industry
â¢ On outskirts of town
â¢ Next to main transport routes (highway or railroad)
â¢ Near a river
â¢ Indicated by large black blocks on the map
In Paper 1 and Paper 2 you may be asked to identify the 
land use zones seen in diagrams, cartoons, photographs and 
on a topographic map or on an orthophoto. You may also be asked to describe the 
characteristics of the land use zone. Learn the above information to help you answer  
the question.
CIAL ATTENTION

 Activity 3.5
This activity is a mapwork interpretation of a settlement. Refer to the 
topographic map 2530BD Nelspruit and the orthophoto map extract at 
the back of this study guide and answer the following questions.
1. Nelspruit/Mbombela is the capital of which South African  
province? 
(1 Ã 2 = 2)
2. a)  What factors influenced the site of Nelspruit/ 
Mbombela? 
(4 Ã 2 = 8)
b) Discuss the situation of Nelspruit/Mbombela. 
(3 Ã 2 = 6)
3. a)  Identify the settlement pattern in block C2. Give a  
reason to support your answer. 
(2 Ã 2 = 4)
b) What is the shape of the settlement in block B3?  
Why do you think it has taken this shape? 
(2 Ã 2 = 4)
4. Classify the type of farming in block C3 as fully as possible, 
explaining your answer. 
(3 Ã 2 = 6)
5. a)  What is different about the farm Friedenheim in block  
C5? 
(1 Ã 2 = 2)
